title: Royal Caribbean earnings hit by Hurricane Dorian
text: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. RCL, +0.95% said Wednesday it had net income of $883.2 million, or $4.20 a share, in the third quarter, up from 4810 million, or $3.86 a share, in the year-earlier period. The numbers include a 13 cents a share impact from itinerary disruptions and relief efforts related to Hurricane Dorian. Adjusted per-share earnings came to $4.27, below the $4.31 FactSet consensus. Revenue rose to $3.187 billion from $2.796 billion, also below the FactSet consensus of $3.220 billion. "While Hurricane Dorian had a negative impact, stronger demand for our brands and our key itineraries exceeded our expectations," Chief Executive Richard Fain said in a statement. "Excluding the hurricane impact, we are not only able to maintain our yield and earnings guidance, but to raise both slightly as a result of particularly strong performance in the US and China." Gross yields rose 5.4%, while net cruise costs rose 10.4%. The company is now expecting full-year adjusted EPS of $9.50 to $9.55 a share, including a roughly 15 cents impact from the hurricane. Shares rose 1.5% premarket and are up 16% in 2019, while the S&P 500 [s; spx] has gained 21%.
